sub_title: DfSS Program Lead & Master Black Belt at Philips CTO
summary:
Philips Research is a global organization that helps Philips introduce meaningful innovations that improve people’s lives. We provide technology options in the area of Healthcare, Lifestyle and Technology, for both developed and emerging markets.In this function I act as a bridgehead between innovation and industrialization in several projects. I either contributed to or made relevant technological choices during the different stages of a project.

Specialties: Process and product development
Surface functionalization
MEMS
LED materials
X ray detector materials

profile_positions.description:
As Design for Six Sigma Program Leader, I'm responsible of DfSS program within Philips Chief Technology Office, including Research.
Responsibilities:
-  Apply Six Sigma methodology, best practices and standards, 
-  Consult projects and programs by supplying templates, best practices, (on the job) training, access to information and lessons learnt from other projects
- Coach and Certify DfSS Green Belts and Black Belts in the organization 
- Have expert knowledge of DfSS tools and methodology and can support others in applying these in (selected) projects
profile_positions.title: Design for Six Sigma Program Leader

profile_positions.description:
As certified DfSS Master Black Belt (from 2018) responsible for the DfSS program within Philips Research.
Responsibilities:
- Establishing and improving the DfSS program within Philips Research
- Providing DIDOV trainings (Awareness, Green and Black Belt)
- Certification of GB and BB
- Coaching of BB
- Development of the training material
profile_positions.title: Master Black Belt

profile_positions.description:
System architect in projects related to:
•	Product development of patient monitoring devices (e.g. ECG, SpO2)
•	Product and technology development of wearable ultrasound devices
profile_positions.title: System Architect

profile_positions.description:
Participated in projects related to:
•	Process and product architect in the development of next generation CT detectors
•	Product development of micro fluidic inkjet devices
•	Product development of patient monitoring devices (e.g. ECG, SpO2)
profile_positions.title: Senior Scientist

profile_positions.description:
Participated in projects related to:
•	Process and product architect in the development of next generation CT detectors
•	Project leader research project for new generation large area lighting
•	Product development of micro fluidic inkjet devices
•	Process and product development of new medical devices (IVD)
profile_positions.title: Process and product technologist

profile_positions.description:
Participated in projects related to:
•	Thin film processing of micro fluidic inkjet devices and sensors
•	Process and product development of thin film (CuInS) solar cells 
•	Product research on thin wafer silicon solar cells
•	Liquid manipulation and surface modification of plastics for micro fluidic devices
•	Process and product development of new medical devices (IVD)
•	Process architecture of new medical devices (IVD)
profile_positions.title: Process and Product Technologist

profile_positions.description:
Resistive switching in polymer-metal oxide diodes for electronic memory applications:

•	The goal of my project was to develop an organic memory device based upon resistive switching in metal-insulator-metal (MIM) structures. The reason for studying is because of its potential application in data storage.
This project is part of the Dutch Polymer Institute (DPI) programma.
profile_positions.title: PhD student

profile_positions.description:
Resistive switching in polymer-metal oxide diodes for electronic memory applications:
- prof. R.A.J. Janssen (Molecular Materials and Nanosystems at Eindhoven University of Technology) and 
- prof. D.M. de Leeuw (Philips Research at High Tech Campus Eindhoven)


•	The goal of my project was to develop an organic memory device based upon resistive switching in metal-insulator-metal (MIM) structures. The reason for studying is because of its potential application in data storage.
This project is part of the Dutch Polymer Institute (DPI) programma
profile_positions.title: PhD student
